page.title: 18INDUSTRIES III
page.content:
The remaining industries are:-
Brownlees which is the largest timber and plywood merchant in Scotland with fourteen branches. The Kirkcaldy branch was started in 1962 and employs sixteen people. Allen Lithographers who were started by J.H. Allen at the start of the twentieth century. The company employs seventy five people.The factory and head office are in Kirkcaldy. Thomson Bros., formed in 1870 by Joseph Thomson. They are structural engineers and metal fabricators who also have an ironmongery department. Fife Forge, founded in 1873 by the Harley family, make fittings for ships At one time 150 people were employed. Now it is only 30. Both Thomson Bros. and Fife Forge have been taken over by Fife Indmar.
